docs.title: Create a Wordpress Staging Site On Eco Hosting
docs.text: Eco Hosting https://www.ecohosting.co.uk/ are a UK based webhosting service. According to their website their hosting is carbon neutral and powered by renewable energy.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Your hosting provider is Eco Hosting
  • Your hosting plan includes Managed Wordpress

docs.title: 1. Login to your Eco Hosting account
docs.text: https://secure.ecohosting.co.uk/clientarea.php

docs.title: 2. Go to the cPanel dashboard
docs.text:
Under 'Your Active Products/Services', next to the site that you want set up a staging for, click on 'Manage'.

Under 'Actions' click on 'Log in to cPanel'.

docs.title: 3. Go to Wordpress Manager
docs.text: Under 'Software' click on 'Wordpress Manager by Softaculous'

docs.title: 4. Create a staging site
docs.text:
In the list of installations, click on the down arrow next to the installation you want to create the staging site for.

Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click on 'Staging'.

Next to 'Choose Installation URL', you should see you current domain. To the right of this, enter the subdirectory where you which the clone of your live site to be stored (e.g. 'staging')

Click on 'Create Staging'

If successful, you should see the message:

** Congratulations, the staging was created successfully WordPress Staging has been successfully created at : https://your-domain/staging Administrative URL : https://your-domain/staging/wp-admin/ **

docs.title: 1. Backup you live site
docs.text:
• e.g. using Softaculous or Updraft Plus
  • Staging is not the same as backing up

docs.title: 2. Make your changes
docs.text:
• Make the required changes to your site at yourdomain.com/staging.
  • When you are satisfied you can push the changes to your live site.

docs.title: Setting Up a Blog with GitHub Pages
docs.text: Using MkDocs and Material for MkDocs theme.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Markdown-based posts
  • Syntax highlighting for code
  • A clean interface
  • Free hosting on GitHub Pages

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• A GitHub account
  • Python installed (3.7 or higher)
  • Basic terminal/command line usage

docs.title: 1. Create a folder for your blog
docs.text:
mkdir my-tech-blog
cd my-tech-blog

docs.title: 2. Create a Python virtual environment
docs.text:
python -m venv .venv

Activate it:

  • On Mac/Linux: bash source .venv/bin/activate
  • On Windows: bash .venv\Scripts\activate

docs.title: 3. Install MkDocs and the Material theme
docs.text: pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: 4. Create your site
docs.text: mkdocs new .

docs.title: 5. Change the theme
docs.text:
Edit the mkdocs.yml file:

site_name: My Tech Blog
theme:
  name: material

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Blog:
      - "Getting Started": 2025-05-19-first-post.md

docs.title: 6. Add your first post
docs.text: Create a file at docs/2025-05-19-first-post.md with the contents of this tutorial!

docs.title: 7. Preview your site locally
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser.

docs.title: 8. Push to GitHub and deploy
docs.text:
1. Create a GitHub repo.
  2. Push your code:
git init
git add .
git commit -m "initial blog"
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/YOUR-REPO.git
git push -u origin main
  1. Deploy:
mkdocs gh-deploy

Your site should now be live at https://your-username.github.io/your-repo-name/
